meta.name: 30-Day Program
meta.description: A complete program to anchor new habits and strengthen your freedom.

1.title: New beginning
1.lesson: Every day is a new chance. You start this program by choice, not obligation. It's an act of courage.

exercise.prompt: Why are you starting this program today? What is your deep 'why'?

2.title: Mapping the cycle
2.lesson: Mentally draw your cycle: trigger → thought → emotion → behavior → consequence. Each link is an intervention opportunity.

exercise.prompt: Describe your typical cycle from trigger to consequence.

3.title: Deep urge surfing
3.lesson: Practice non-judgmental observation. The urge is not you. You can watch it pass like a cloud.

exercise.prompt: Practice 2 minutes of observing your bodily sensations without reacting.

4.title: My values - part 1
4.lesson: Values are what truly matters to you. Not what you 'should' want, but what makes you come alive.

exercise.prompt: In an ideal world, what kind of person would you want to be?

5.title: My values - part 2
5.lesson: When your actions align with your values, you feel peace. When they conflict, the dissonance creates suffering.

exercise.prompt: Your 3 most important values and how to honor them this week.

6.title: If-then rule #1
6.lesson: Your first positive automatism: a simple rule that triggers automatically.

exercise.prompt: Create your first if-then rule for your most frequent situation.

7.title: Week 1 review
7.lesson: One week completed. Take time to acknowledge what worked and what was difficult.

exercise.prompt: 3 positive things from this week + 1 challenge you overcame.

8.title: Cognitive restructuring
8.lesson: Our automatic thoughts trap us. 'Just once' is a lie the addicted brain tells.

exercise.prompt: Identify a toxic automatic thought and reformulate it.

9.title: Environment as ally
9.lesson: Every friction added to undesired behavior helps. Every facilitation of healthy behavior helps too.

exercise.prompt: 2 concrete environment changes for this week.

10.title: Identifying emotions
10.lesson: Behind every urge often hides an unrecognized emotion. Naming the emotion reduces its power.

exercise.prompt: What emotion most often pushes you toward the undesired behavior?

11.title: Meeting real needs
11.lesson: If the emotion hides a need, find healthy ways to meet that need.

exercise.prompt: For the emotion identified yesterday, 3 healthy ways to respond.

12.title: The power of movement
12.lesson: Physical activity releases endorphins, reduces stress, and occupies body and mind.

exercise.prompt: What movement can you integrate daily? (even 5 min)

13.title: If-then rule #2
13.lesson: A second rule for another at-risk situation.

exercise.prompt: Create a rule for another frequent trigger.

14.title: Mid-point review
14.lesson: Two weeks! You've built solid foundations. The brain is starting to create new connections.

exercise.prompt: What has changed most since the beginning? What remains difficult?

15.title: Social connection
15.lesson: Isolation feeds addiction. Authentic connection fights it.

exercise.prompt: Who could you contact this week to strengthen a bond?

16.title: Emergency plan 5-5-60
16.lesson: In the first 5 seconds, first 5 minutes, first hour: a precise plan.

exercise.prompt: Your complete emergency plan.

17.title: Daily gratitude
17.lesson: Gratitude rewires the brain toward the positive. Daily practice = lasting change.

exercise.prompt: 3 gratitudes from today, even the smallest ones.

18.title: Managing relapses
18.lesson: If relapse, no shame spiral. Analyze, learn, restart. Shame prolongs the cycle.

exercise.prompt: If a relapse happened, what would be your kind self-talk?

19.title: Risk hours
19.lesson: Identify your vulnerable moments and prepare specific responses.

exercise.prompt: What are your highest-risk hours? What alternative activity for those moments?

20.title: If-then rule #3
20.lesson: A third rule, perhaps for the identified risk hours.

exercise.prompt: Rule for your risk hours.

21.title: Week 3 review
21.lesson: Three weeks. The new behavior is becoming more natural. Old habits are weakening.

exercise.prompt: How do you feel compared to day 1?

22.title: 1-year vision
22.lesson: Visualize your life in one year, free. What are you doing differently? How do you feel?

exercise.prompt: Describe a typical day in your life in 1 year, free.

23.title: Letter to myself
23.lesson: Write a letter to your future self going through a difficult moment.

exercise.prompt: Dear future me, when you're going through a difficult moment...

24.title: Reinforcing victories
24.lesson: Celebrating small victories reinforces healthy reward circuits.

exercise.prompt: List 5 victories (even small ones) since the beginning of the program.

25.title: Mental traps
25.lesson: Recognize the traps: minimization, rationalization, 'deserve', 'just once'.

exercise.prompt: What mental trap catches you most often? How to counter it?

26.title: Relapse prevention
26.lesson: Identify early warning signs and have a plan before reaching the point of no return.

exercise.prompt: What are your early warning signs? (mood, behaviors, thoughts)

27.title: Identity reinforcement
27.lesson: You are not someone who 'tries to stop'. You are someone who lives differently.

exercise.prompt: Complete: 'I am a person who...' (new identity)

28.title: Week 4 review
28.lesson: Four weeks! New neural pathways have formed. You've proven it's possible.

exercise.prompt: 3 gratitudes for yourself and your journey.

29.title: Plan for after
29.lesson: The program ends, but the path continues. What practices do you keep?

exercise.prompt: 3 practices from the program you continue + your most important rule.

30.title: Celebration and commitment
30.lesson: 30 days. You did something difficult. Celebrate, then commit to what's next.

exercise.prompt: How do you celebrate? What commitment for the next 30 days?
